final_answer:
The humor in this image comes from the contrast between expectations and reality. On the left, there's a tattoo of a snake on a hand, depicted in a stylish and artistic manner—something someone might find cool or appealing. The caption "YES," suggests approval or admiration of this artistic design.

On the right, the "BUT" leads to an unexpected twist: a real, 3D snake wrapped around a chair, facing a jumping silhouette of a person attempting to escape. This side humorously exaggerates the fear or surprise one might associate with encountering a real snake.

The satirical element lies in contrasting the aesthetic appeal of a snake tattoo with the intimidating presence of a real snake, playing on the idea that while something may look attractive in theory (or as art), reality can be quite different and more daunting.
